title: Figma Buzz Unveils Three Key Features to Accelerate Brand Asset Creation and Momentum

paragraphs.content: Figma has introduced three new features for Figma Buzz—configurable marketing templates linked to design systems, plugin integrations for tools like digital asset management and animation, and in-platform video trimming—to empower designers and marketers in creating on-brand assets efficiently.These updates, announced around late 2025 during Config 2025, address user feedback by reducing tool-switching and enhancing customization without compromising brand consistency.Figma Buzz, initially launched for social posts, digital ads, and event materials, now supports bulk editing via simplified UI and AI tools.

paragraphs.content: The features enable teams to publish templates using component properties, access plugins such as Brandfolder for DAM or LottieFiles for animation, and trim videos directly to fit time constraints like social ads.This positions Buzz within Figma's expansive 2025 lineup, including Sites, Draw, and Make, fostering converged workflows for marketing and creative teams.Industry observers note these enhancements signal a shift toward hybrid roles blending design and adaptability.

sections.title: Configurable Templates and Plugin Ecosystem Streamline On-Brand Production

paragraphs.content: Configurable templates now leverage component properties from Figma design systems, allowing marketers to browse variations, switch layouts, and customize without sifting through options or risking off-brand edits.Plugins integrate seamlessly for digital asset management, translation systems like Lokalise, and animation, with teams able to create internal or community plugins via Figma's Schema framework.Figma's blog emphasizes: "Set up and publish templates using component properties, so it’s simple for marketers to browse and switch between flexible templates."

paragraphs.content: Video trimming provides precise control over MP4 or MOV files, enabling cropping, syncing clips, and basic adjustments directly in Buzz for event collages or ads.These tools build on prior video import/export, eliminating external software toggling.Release notes contextualize this within Figma's 150+ 2025 features, crediting user feedback for deeper workflow integration.

sections.title: Industry Reactions Highlight Workflow Shifts and Competitive Edge

paragraphs.content: At Config 2025, experts like product designers Natasha Tenggoro and Aosheng praised Buzz for sub-menus and AI image generation via OpenAI’s GPT-image-1, easing overwhelm for users.UX Playbook analysis notes excitement alongside skepticism, with some designers critiquing tool proliferation amid Figma's expansion.TechCrunch highlighted Buzz's $8/month Content Seat plan, covering bulk asset creation from spreadsheets and AI insertions, positioning it against Canva.
